Docs.summary: Represents a customized view of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Whenever data is displayed, such as in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control, only one version of each row can be displayed. The displayed row is a <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>.
A <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> can have one of four different version states: `Default`, `Original`, `Current`, and `Proposed`.
After invoking <xref:System.Data.DataRow.BeginEdit%2A> on a <xref:System.Data.DataRow>, any edited value becomes the `Proposed` value. Until either <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.CancelEdit%2A> or <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.EndEdit%2A> is invoked, the row has an `Original` and a `Proposed` version. If <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.CancelEdit%2A> is invoked, the proposed version is discarded, and the value reverts to `Original`. If <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.EndEdit%2A> is invoked, the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> no longer has a `Proposed` version; instead, the proposed value becomes the current value. Default values are available only on rows that have columns with default values defined.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.RowVersion%2A> property to determine the state of a row in the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>. (See <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowFilter%2A> for another example using <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>.)
[!code-csharp[DataWorks DataRowView.RowVersion1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/DataWorks DataRowView.RowVersion1/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[DataWorks DataRowView.RowVersion1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/DataWorks DataRowView.RowVersion1/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.threadsafe: This type is safe for multithreaded read operations. You must synchronize any write operations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void BeginEdit() cil managed
abstract member BeginEdit : unit -> unit override this.BeginEdit : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Begins an edit procedure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use <xref:System.Data.DataView.AddNew%2A> to add a <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>.
The <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.BeginEdit%2A> method is identical to the <xref:System.Data.DataRow.BeginEdit%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method of the <xref:System.Data.DataRow>. After calling <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.BeginEdit%2A>, any changes made to the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> can be rolled back by calling <xref:System.Data.DataRow.CancelEdit%2A>. Call the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.BeginEdit%2A> method before allowing users to change row values. After values have been changed, you retrieve the new values by setting the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.RowVersion%2A> to `DataRowVersion.Proposed`. Check the values with a business rule, and roll back the changes if needed by calling <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.CancelEdit%2A>, or call <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.EndEdit%2A> to accept the changes.
## Examples The following example edits a row in a <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>. calling the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.BeginEdit%2A> before, and <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.EndEdit%2A> afterwards.
[!code-csharp[Classic WebData DataRowView.BeginEdit Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataRowView.BeginEdit Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData DataRowView.BeginEdit Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataRowView.BeginEdit Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Cancels an edit procedure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks After calling <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.CancelEdit%2A>, all changes to the row are rolled back. You can also roll back changes by calling <xref:System.Data.DataTable.RejectChanges%2A> on the parent <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
## Examples The following example edits a row in a <xref:System.Data.DataView>. The <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.CancelEdit%2A> method is called to cancel the changes if the validation fails.
[!code-csharp[Classic WebData DataRowView.BeginEdit Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataRowView.BeginEdit Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData DataRowView.BeginEdit Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataRowView.BeginEdit Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Delete() cil managed

Docs.summary: Deletes a row.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The row is not permanently deleted until <xref:System.Data.DataTable.AcceptChanges%2A> is invoked on the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> that the row belongs to.
> [!NOTE] > A <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> may be invalid when a `DataRow` is deleted from the underlying table. When the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView> becomes invalid, operations that access values associated with <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>, such as <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.Delete%2A>, throw an exception.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.Delete%2A> method on a row.
[!code-csharp[Classic WebData DataRowView.Delete Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataRowView.Delete Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData DataRowView.Delete Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataRowView.Delete Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

This method checks for reference equality instead of checking whether <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.DataView> or <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.Row> are equivalent.

Docs.value: if the row is new; otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks After you call you call <xref:System.Data.DataView.AddNew%2A>, <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.IsNew%2A> will be true for the returned <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>. <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.IsNew%2A> will be true until either <xref:System.Data.DataRowView.EndEdit%2A> is called on the <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>, or <xref:System.Data.DataView.AddNew%2A> is called again. (There is only one new row.)
